Description: Part of a terracotta mould: head of Medusa. A mould for a mask of Medusa, with wings, and snakes tied beneath the chin. The back is rough and rounded, and has a pierced lug handle applied near the top. Probably a one-piece mould. Brown Nile silt with white inclusions and a largely grey-brown surface.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3472)
Condition: The lower part is lost and there is damage on the front to the right side of the gorgon’s head.
